=== About Me ===

Hello, I'm Valorie Zimmerman, Kubuntu member. I'm active daily on both Linuxchix and Freenode IRC, nick valorie. My main interests in Kubuntu are documentation and community. I wrote the <nowiki>[[http://userbase.kde.org/Amarok/Manual|Handbook]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[http://amarok.kde.org/en/Insider|Amarok Insider]]</nowiki> for Amarok, and am also active in <nowiki>[[http://www.linuxchix.org|Linuxchix]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://seattlelinuxchix.org/|Seattle Linuxchix]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://ubuntu-women.org/|Ubuntu Women]]</nowiki>, and the <nowiki>[[http://loco.ubuntu.com/teams/ubuntu-washington|Washington Ubuntu LoCo (Local Community)]]</nowiki>. I also write the <nowiki>[[http://linuxgrandma.blogspot.com|"Linux Grandma" blog]]</nowiki>.

Other activities: My family, reading, art, music, photography, <nowiki>[[http://www.pflag.org|PFLAG (Parents, Family & Friends of Lesbians and Gays)]]</nowiki>, and genealogy, including <nowiki>[[http://alsach.at|Alsachat]]</nowiki>, an international genealogy project.

=== Future Goals ===

I plan to continue updating the Amarok Handbook, and find other tech writing and community building projects which need doing in Kubuntu and KDE. I'm continuing as a part of the KDE Community Working Group, and part of the administration of <nowiki>[[http://community.kde.org/GSoC|Google Summer of Code, and Google CodeIn]]</nowiki>. I want the Washington LoCo to grow, and become official, and continue to have fun. I plan to promote Kubuntu at <nowiki>[[http://linuxfestnorthwest.org/|LinuxFestNorthWest]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[https://seagl.org SeaGL]]</nowiki> again, and will continue on the Council. I'm also planning to attend <nowiki>[[http://akademy2018.kde.org/|Akademy]]</nowiki> again this year. The Kubuntu team plans a BoF at Akademy. 

=== Testimonials ===

Valorie is a tremendous help with driving and planning activities for the Ubuntu Washington LoCo. Her cheerful personality makes her great company. We are very lucky to have her around. -- <nowiki>[[LaunchpadHome:linda-halligan]]</nowiki> 
I've seen Valorie help out in the Kubuntu channels and the UW channel.  She is awesome and I would truely +1 her for Kubuntu membership. -- <nowiki>[[LaunchpadHome:nigelbabu]]</nowiki> 
Valorie was my first friend in the FOSS community, by which I mean: she introduced me to the FOSS community.  She taught me to use IRC and introduced me to all the wonderful mentors and role models I've had through LinuxChix.  Aside from being on the (figurative) Welcome Brigade in Ubuntu Women, she seems to do a good job of maintaining good relationships with upstream too, and that's always important work. -- <nowiki>[[LaunchpadHome:maco.m]]</nowiki> 
Valorie is awesome: she is a very productive contributor, a great motivator and community builder and always has a helping hand. Without her the community would not be as strong and by far not as much fun. I fully support her application to be a Kubuntu member. -- <nowiki>[[LaunchpadHome:myriam]]</nowiki> <<DateTime>>

Valorie was a valuable contributor to the OSCON 2011 Ubuntu Booth, She advocates for women who use Ubuntu/Kubuntu which is an excellent initiative for the open source community. I look forward to collaborating with her on future Ubuntu LoCo stuff. -- <nowiki>[[LaunchpadHome:bkerensa]]</nowiki> <<DateTime>>
